entry.title: üß† Por que SABER n√£o √© suficiente: o papel da intelig√™ncia emocional no seu sucesso profissional
entry.content:
üß© Este conte√∫do √© diferente do que voc√™ costuma ver aqui no meu perfil, mas √© essencial para qualquer profissional.

Hoje n√£o vou falar de SAP ou Integra√ß√£o no SAP CPI. Vou falar sobre algo que impacta diretamente sua carreira: a forma como voc√™ se comporta, se comunica, lida com pessoas e reage a situa√ß√µes.

Tudo isso est√° ligado √† sua intelig√™ncia emocional. E ela pode ser o fator decisivo entre crescer ou estagnar na sua trajet√≥ria profissional.

Neste artigo, quero compartilhar com voc√™ uma reflex√£o sobre QI x QE, como isso afeta seu dia a dia no trabalho e na fam√≠lia, e como a ferramenta DISC pode te ajudar a evoluir como profissional.

üíºN√£o h√° d√∫vida de que, para termos sucesso na vida profissional, precisamos desenvolver habilidades. E normalmente, o foco est√° nas habilidades cognitivas, como fazer uma faculdade, aprender ingl√™s, fazer cursos‚Ä¶ tudo isso relacionado ao nosso QI (Coeficiente de Intelig√™ncia).

E sim, isso √© importante!

Mas‚Ä¶ ü§î E se eu te disser que essas habilidades representam apenas 20% do que voc√™ precisa para conquistar o sucesso?

üìöO que realmente faz a diferen√ßa: o QE

Segundo Daniel Goleman, PhD em Psicologia e autor do livro "Intelig√™ncia Emocional", 80% do sucesso est√° diretamente relacionado ao QE (Coeficiente de Intelig√™ncia Emocional).

Ou seja, o que mais te impede de alcan√ßar o sucesso n√£o √© o que voc√™ SABE, mas o que voc√™ FAZ (ou deixa de FAZER).

üß© Diferen√ßa entre QI e QE

Vamos organizar isso de forma simples e clara. Veja essa tabela comparativa:

Resumo Comparativo  entre QI e QE

Resumo

Cada habilidade √© desenvolvida e utilizada de forma diferente.

O QI representa o nosso SABER, enquanto o QE est√° ligado ao FAZER.

O QI se desenvolve com o tempo: engatinhar, sentar, andar, falar‚Ä¶ J√° o QE nasce de est√≠mulos, experi√™ncias e observa√ß√µes. Ele est√° profundamente conectado ao sentimento: o que importa n√£o √© o que aconteceu, mas como voc√™ se SENTIU diante da experi√™ncia.

Ah, ent√£o Neylon, voc√™ est√° dizendo que eu posso abandonar as habilidades cognitivas?

‚Äî Claro que n√£o! Se voc√™ fizer isso, n√£o vai alcan√ßar sucesso.

‚ö°Saber n√£o √© suficiente

Vamos sair um pouco do ambiente profissional para entender melhor:

  • üö¨Fumar faz mal? Todo mundo SABE que sim. Mesmo assim, muitos continuam. Por qu√™? Porque n√£o √© o QI que impede, √© o QE. Existe um v√≠cio, sim, mas tamb√©m h√° uma carga emocional que dificulta a mudan√ßa.
  • üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Fazer exerc√≠cios faz bem? Tamb√©m todo mundo SABE. Mas nem todo mundo FAZ. O problema n√£o √© o cognitivo, √© o emocional.

üëâOu seja, muitas vezes o problema n√£o √© SABER o que FAZER, √© conseguir FAZER o que SABE.

üëâIsso mostra que, na vida, muitas vezes voc√™ SABE o que precisa fazer, mas n√£o faz. Isso deixa claro que seu lado cognitivo, dado por Deus, funciona perfeitamente, mas suas habilidades emocionais ainda n√£o foram desenvolvidas.

üíºE no trabalho?

Voc√™ SABE que n√£o deve gritar com colegas, ser r√≠spido, ignorar opini√µes... Mas mesmo sabendo, √†s vezes voc√™ FAZ.

Isso √© falta de QI? N√£o. √â sua intelig√™ncia emocional que precisa ser desenvolvida.

üßì "Ah Neylon, mas muito disso √© falta de MATURIDADE, com o tempo a pessoa aprende!"

‚Äî N√£o, maturidade n√£o vem com o tempo.

Se fosse assim, n√£o ver√≠amos pessoas mais velhas cometendo os mesmos erros repetidamente. A maturidade √© uma habilidade emocional, n√£o apenas cognitiva. Isso explica por que existem pessoas mais velhas sem maturidade.

üòîPor que tanta gente est√° frustrada no trabalho?

  • Uma pessoa gosta de explicar tudo com detalhes. Seu colega, mais direto, acha isso desnecess√°rio. Resultado? Frustra√ß√£o.
  • Um chefe √© objetivo e direto. O colaborador sente isso como falta de empatia. Resultado? Mais frustra√ß√£o.
  • Jo√£o teve um dia ruim e respondeu Pedro de forma r√≠spida. Pedro ficou chateado, mas Jo√£o nem percebeu (ou percebeu e ignorou). O que importa aqui n√£o foi a fala em si, mas como PEDRO se SENTIU.

üéØO que √© comum e normal para voc√™ pode ser interpretado de forma totalmente diferente por outra pessoa.E isso acontece no trabalho, em casa, na vida.

üîçE como melhorar isso?

O primeiro passo √© o autoconhecimento.

A ferramenta DISC ajuda voc√™ a entender seu perfil comportamental ‚Äî como voc√™ age, reage, se comunica, e tamb√©m como se relaciona com quem √© diferente de voc√™.

Perfil Neylon Silva

 

üìäOs 4 perfis do DISC (resumido)

  • Dominante: Autoconfiante, direto, orientado a resultados
  • Influente: Comunicativo, entusiasmado, envolvente
  • Est√°vel: Calmo, paciente, cooperativo
  • Anal√≠tico: Cauteloso, preciso, gosta de detalhes

ü§ùQuer saber mais?

üíºVoc√™ pode ser excelente tecnicamente, mas se n√£o souber lidar com pessoas, press√µes e frustra√ß√µes, vai acabar travando seu pr√≥prio crescimento.

Espero que esse conte√∫do tenha te feito refletir. Se quiser conversar mais sobre intelig√™ncia emocional ou aplicar a an√°lise DISC na sua equipe, estou √† disposi√ß√£o.

Afinal, tecnologia leva voc√™ longe, mas comportamento leva voc√™ al√©m. üöÄ

entry.title: Call for Speakers - SAP Inside Track Gurugram 2025 - Third Edition
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community! 

We are thrilled to announce that the speaker registration is now open for SAP Inside Track Gurugram 2025 

Event Registration details: üì¢ SAP Inside Track Gurgaon 2025 ‚Äì Third Edition! - SAP Community

Date:‚ÄØNovember 22, 2025 
Time:‚ÄØ9 AM - 5 PM IST‚ÄØ
Venue:‚ÄØSAP Labs India, Golf Course Rd, Suncity, Sector 54, Gurugram, Haryana 122002, India 

 

Topics for 2025

This year, we‚Äôre focusing on curated topic sessions around Business AI in SAP. We invite proposals in the following areas:

 SAP AI Strategy & Roadmap

 Embedded AI in SAP Solutions

 Building with SAP AI Agents

 Business AI Solutions (SAP)

 SAP Business Data Cloud

 SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)

 AI Innovations: Partners & Customers

If you have experience, insights, or success stories in any of these topics, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

 

 Why Speak at SAP Inside Track Gurgaon?

 

 Showcase Your Expertise ‚Äì Share your journey, technical know-how, or innovative projects with a highly engaged SAP audience.

 Network with Peers ‚Äì Build connections with fellow professionals, partners, and community leaders.

 Inspire and Be Recognized ‚Äì Position yourself as a thought leader within the SAP community.

 

 Speaker Registration is Now Open!

 Submit your proposal here: Speaker Registration for SIT Gurgaon 2025

Next Steps: Once you submit your proposal,
Step 1: Our expert team will go through your proposal and if it is shortlisted, we will contact you for more details.
Step 2: This will again be discussed internally with the experts and once shortlisted, we will inform you about the next steps ‚Äì like presentation format, social media advertisement etc.

We look forward to your valuable contributions and to seeing you at SAP Inside Track Gurugram 2025.

Best Regards,

SAP Community Gurgaon Core Team

entry.title: Getting error while creating new Content Provider in Build Work Zone cockpit
entry.content:
Steps to reproduce :
1. go to BTP cockpit->Instances & subscription->Build Work Zone cockpit / Channel Manager / New Content Provider.

2. Add design time and runtime destinations.

3. Click save.

4. getting error

Connectivity/InternalError: Could not fetch content due to an internal error. Please try again later. If the issue persists, please open a ticket on the connectivity service.

5. PFA screenshot.

Please respond if anyone has solution.

debug: I clicked - 'test connection' in both destinations, its successful connection.

entry.title: We has a very succesful meet up last November 4th
entry.content:
Thanks to all those who join our first event after the community re-launch. üöÄüöÄüöÄ

I was so pleased to see everyone just got together and chatty when we first met.

We watch the Keynote session, had some snacks and beverages.
It made me so happy to hear form many of you that restarting the community is a great initiative.

We are already brainstorming on our next event, and see if we can squeeze a x-mas beer before the end of the year. üçª

entry.title: SAP TechED 2025 in Berlin - a new high!
entry.content:
Injured but thriving nevertheless

 

Coming back from SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin, I found myself being wheelchaired out of Zaventem Airport in Belgium. My inflamed Achilles tendon had worsened over the course of the event.

I probably should have been resting, but I was determined to be there. Between participating in the DemoJam finals, giving a presentation, meeting with SAP leadership through the SAP Mentors program, and reconnecting with so many community members, SAP Champions, and fellow Mentors, missing it simply wasn‚Äôt an option.

By the end, I could barely walk. I managed to push through for a few days, but eventually my body said, ‚Äúenough is enough,‚Äù and it quite literally shut down on the last day of SAP TechEd.

Even at what could be seen as a low point, I couldn‚Äôt stop smiling because the experience, the people, and the inspiration made it all worth it.

Caretakers

A huge thank you to Raf B. for wheeling me out of the airport, and to Jana de Klerk for taking such great care of me throughout the event. From fetching ice to taking me to the medical post at SAP TechEd. Also, sincere thanks to J√©r√©my Coppey and Wouter Lemaire for all their help and for carrying my things around when I couldn‚Äôt.

I‚Äôm truly grateful for the amazing friends I have and for all the support they gave me when I needed it most.

SAP TechED DemoJam 2025 winners

 

One of the absolute highlights for me and a new all-time high was winning the SAP DemoJam 2025 final at SAP TechEd in Berlin.

Wouter and I had a blast presenting our use case. Our goal was to show that developing with the latest SAP technologies and sharing what we build can be great fun. We both love the community spirit and feel proud to be an active part of it.

Our demo was based on a real Artificial Intelligence use case for Infrabel (Belgium), powered by a wide range of SAP technologies behind the scenes. The idea came from automating some of my own recurring system monitoring tasks. In other words, turning a practical challenge into an innovative solution.

To make it engaging, we turned it into a friendly battle: I performed the tasks the ‚Äúold-fashioned‚Äù way, while Wouter used the AI-driven application we had built. With a touch of humor and a lot of energy, we managed to deliver a DemoJam that truly resonated with the audience: blending lighthearted banter with serious SAP innovation.

Team efforts

We‚Äôd like to thank our customer Infrabel for the opportunity to work with the latest SAP technologies. A special thanks to Kevin Verzele and to everyone in the team who supported us among others, Brieuc Bernard and Tom Van de Velde . Thank you all!

The trophy will be placed at the customer‚Äôs site as a token of appreciation, symbolizing that this achievement was truly a team effort.

Working on the MCP server application

We had some fascinating discussions with SAP and Microsoft during SAP TechEd about our Artificial Intelligence journey. Specifically around using MCP with SAP S/4HANA data. These conversations sparked fresh ideas and inspired us to push the boundaries of what‚Äôs currently possible. Needless to say, we spent at least one evening in our Airbnb apartment exploring those new possibilities even further.

I'll give you a quick example of a pump comparison. The product has been fetched from actual SAP product data and is then compared against other pumps by combining SAP S/4 HANA data with online data. This is just a quick showcase snippet. I'll write up another article to detail this out further.

 

There was a lot of "MCP" visible on architectural slides and announcements in terms of support for MCP and in terms of SAP making use of MCP which showed that MCP is the new kid on the block and the "hotness" right now when it comes to Artificial Intelligence.

SAP Mentors

 

The SAP Mentor program has, without a doubt, had a profound impact on my professional journey. It continues to be a tremendous source of inspiration. Surrounded by so many brilliant minds and remarkable individuals, I always feel that I‚Äôm growing, learning, and thriving whenever we come together.

We had really productive discussions with SAP. The kind that keep them on their toes and occasionally challenge their thinking. The goal is to provide an outside perspective that helps SAP continue to improve and evolve.

We very much appreciate the time taken by everyone who meets up with us at these conferences and the candid conversations we have with them.

The vision of SAP

 

In my view, SAP‚Äôs technological vision remains truly impressive. Of course, there are still challenges to overcome but that‚Äôs true for every player in the enterprise software space. The current limitations of Artificial Intelligence affect the entire industry.

What sets SAP apart is its bold vision and determination to execute on it. They‚Äôre not just adopting what already exists; they‚Äôre actively thinking ahead, exploring how to push the boundaries of what AI can achieve in the context of enterprise software.

We‚Äôre already in active discussions with SAP on how we can push the needle even further together.

Announcements and demo's

 

While I truly appreciate SAP‚Äôs vision and the technological drive that continues to push boundaries, my heart really jumps for joy when I see live demos on stage. Even if they would fail, I prefer them because they show what‚Äôs possible right now.

Yes, Artificial Intelligence still has its limitations, but it‚Äôs incredible to see how much can already be achieved today and how quickly technology continues to evolve.

Inspired and fuelled up

These events are rocket fuel for me. They ignite something that makes me want to push harder and reach further. The inspiration hits so powerfully that here I am, writing on a Saturday night at 9:30 PM, unable to wait.

It's like hearing that one song that gives you chills and completely shifts your state of mind.

I'm back, and I've already spun up a fresh repository to experiment with new ideas and push boundaries. I'm diving deeper into Artificial Intelligence because I genuinely believe we're standing at the beginning of a transformative journey that will propel technology to heights most can't yet imagine in the months ahead.

See you at SAP TechEd 2026! Something tells me we'll have a lot more to talk about by then.

entry.title: SAP Community Hobbies Series: Most weekends, I jump out of airplanes with my friends
entry.content:
I began skydiving while I was still in high school.  I trained with several of my school friends, and I made my first jumps just after my eighteenth birthday.  I stayed active in the sport through college but eventually gave it up to start a career and, later, a family.

A return after four decades

When folks from that same high school class began planning a 40th anniversary reunion, a few of us who had been part of that original group decided to celebrate in a special way: by skydiving together again.

It was both nostalgic and eye-opening.

Our first jumps had been made with heavy military gear, round parachutes, and G.I. combat boots. What we came back to was an entirely different experience‚Äîrefined equipment, greater emphasis on safety, and the atmosphere of an athletic sport.

In those intervening decades, tandem jumping had become commonplace. Instead of days of training before a first solo jump, beginners can now make a safe, mentored jump strapped to an instructor after just a few hours of preparation. That innovation has made skydiving accessible to millions of people who otherwise might never have tried it.  And the sport has exploded: millions of people now make their first tandem jump in the US each year.

Me, stepping out of a jump plane at 13,500 feet. (Photo: Michael Houston)

For me and my friends, that reunion jump lit a spark. We remembered how much we loved this sport.

That was five years ago.  I have been active in the sport ever since.

Skydiving today spans many disciplines: wingsuits that let people glide like a bird, precision accuracy competitions where landing within millimeters of a target is the goal, or ‚Äúmovement‚Äù dives where jumpers press their bodies against the wind to cover distances across the ground.

My passion is Formation Skydiving - jumping in groups to build patterns in the sky. Sometimes these formations involve dozens or even hundreds of people, sometimes requiring multiple aircraft flying in formation and ‚Äì always - deep levels of focus and discipline for the jumpers to succeed.

A formation skydive that‚Äôs going well - over Southern California ‚Äì me, on the right leg of the gent in yellow.
(Photo: Xian Cam Xtreme Media)

Skydivers come from all sorts of professions.  My skydiving friends are salespeople, accountants, nurses, E.R. doctors, military and police officers. And computer folks - a surprising percentage are computing professionals.  And why is that an indoor and desk bound job also attracts so many of the same people to jump out of planes?  I can offer a guess: when I am dialed into a programming task, the daily distractions of the world disappear.  Time goes away, too.  Psychologists characterize this as something called ‚ÄúFlow State‚Äù.  You are engaged and ‚Äúin the moment‚Äù.  Nothing else matters.  It's a feature of the job that I like. Despite the dramatically different setting, my experience when skydiving brings a similar frame of mind.  Flow State has its own documented rewards.  After a day of jumping, I often have the same upbeat feeling as when I have been on a long run outdoors.

There is a saying floating around the sport, ‚Äúskydiving isn‚Äôt for everyone, but everyone should try it once.‚Äù There is well developed training to prepare you for the safety essentials, but no number of words can prep you for the sights, sounds, and thrill of your first jump.  You just must experience it yourself and today it is more accessible than ever. 

Try it yourself. Come share the skies with me and my skydiving friends.

Next in this series:

Next up, Jan Rumig will be telling you about about long walks and hiking.

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Ciudad del Este 2025: El inicio de una nueva era para la comunidad SAP en Paraguay
entry.content:
El pasado 8 de noviembre, Ciudad del Este fue testigo de un evento hist√≥rico: el primer SAP Inside Track Paraguay. El Hotel Megal se convirti√≥ en el epicentro del conocimiento, la innovaci√≥n y la colaboraci√≥n del ecosistema SAP en el pa√≠s, reuniendo a consultores, l√≠deres de proyectos, empresas y entusiastas de la tecnolog√≠a en una jornada inolvidable.

SITCDE2025- SAP inside Track Paraguay 2025
Un hito para la comunidad SAP paraguaya
Este evento marc√≥ un antes y un despu√©s para la comunidad tecnol√≥gica de Paraguay. Por primera vez, profesionales de SAP del pa√≠s y la regi√≥n se congregaron para compartir experiencias, aprender de casos reales y fortalecer las redes de colaboraci√≥n que impulsan la transformaci√≥n digital en Am√©rica Latina.

Jornada completa de conocimiento e inspiraci√≥n
La agenda del d√≠a estuvo cargada de contenido de alto valor, abarcando desde soluciones de gesti√≥n de talento humano hasta las √∫ltimas tendencias en inteligencia artificial y ciberseguridad cu√°ntica.

Sesiones destacadas

SITCDE2025- SAP inside Track Paraguay 2025

SAP SuccessFactors: Transformando la gesti√≥n del talento
Carolina Salinas Glikin ( Qactions System) abri√≥ la jornada explorando c√≥mo las soluciones de gesti√≥n de capital humano de SAP est√°n revolucionando la forma en que las organizaciones atraen, desarrollan y retienen talento. https://community.sap.com/t5/asunci%C3%B3n-blog-posts/sap-inside-track-paraguay-cde-2025-reinventando-la-experiencia-del-talento/ba-p/14267345

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: Soluciones para empresas de todos los portes
Jean Tiago Baena ( Chess SAP Services) demostr√≥ c√≥mo la nube p√∫blica de S/4HANA democratiza el acceso a tecnolog√≠a de clase mundial, permitiendo que empresas de cualquier tama√±o aceleren su transformaci√≥n digital. https://community.sap.com/t5/asunci%C3%B3n-blog-posts/sap-inside-track-paraguay-cde-2025-sap-public-cloud-agilidade-e-ganhos-com/ba-p/14270555

Ciberseguridad en la era cu√°ntica
Carlos Ben√≠tez (Platinum Ciberseguridad) llev√≥ a los asistentes al futuro de la seguridad inform√°tica, abordando los desaf√≠os y oportunidades que presenta la computaci√≥n cu√°ntica para proteger los activos digitales empresariales.

Planificaci√≥n financiera consolidada y facturaci√≥n electr√≥nica
Juan Jos√© Torres ( Roadmap IT) comparti√≥ estrategias pr√°cticas para optimizar la gesti√≥n financiera corporativa y adaptarse a los requerimientos de facturaci√≥n digital en la regi√≥n.

Del control t√©cnico a la transformaci√≥n √°gil
Esteban Hartzstein ( Tebyon Consulting) inspir√≥ a la audiencia con su visi√≥n sobre c√≥mo los profesionales SAP deben evolucionar para acompa√±ar los cambios acelerados de la era digital.

Revolucionando procesos con inteligencia artificial
Douglas Rodrigues de Figueiredo ( @Teia_Connect ) explor√≥ c√≥mo la IA est√° transformando radicalmente la manera en que las empresas automatizan y optimizan sus operaciones.

SAP BTP y estrategias de migraci√≥n a S/4HANA
Juan Pablo Barril  ( @Kuaa_Technology KUAATEC ) cerr√≥ las sesiones t√©cnicas con una gu√≠a pr√°ctica sobre c√≥mo aprovechar SAP Business Technology Platform para construir el camino hacia S/4HANA de manera exitosa.

M√°s que conferencias: una experiencia comunitaria
El evento no fue solo sobre tecnolog√≠a. Los espacios de networking durante los coffee breaks permitieron que los asistentes intercambiaran ideas, fortalecieran relaciones profesionales y exploraran oportunidades de colaboraci√≥n.

El cierre del evento fue memorable: sorteos, un brindis que celebr√≥ el √©xito del d√≠a y un show musical que reflej√≥ el esp√≠ritu c√°lido y acogedor de la comunidad paraguaya.


Un mensaje claro para el ecosistema SAP
El SAP Inside Track Ciudad del Este 2025 dej√≥ lecciones fundamentales:
üîπLa comunidad es el motor de la innovaci√≥n ‚Äì El conocimiento compartido acelera el crecimiento de todos
üîπParaguay est√° listo para liderar ‚Äì El talento y la pasi√≥n por la tecnolog√≠a est√°n presentes
üîπColaboraci√≥n sin fronteras ‚Äì La transformaci√≥n digital se construye juntos

Gratitud y pr√≥ximos pasos
Este evento fue posible gracias al compromiso de todos los speakers, patrocinadores, organizadores y asistentes que creyeron en la importancia de construir comunidad. Cada presentaci√≥n, cada conversaci√≥n y cada conexi√≥n realizada el 8 de noviembre plant√≥ una semilla para el futuro del ecosistema SAP en Paraguay.

¬øTe lo perdiste? No te preocupes. Este es solo el comienzo. La comunidad SAP Paraguay ya est√° trabajando en los pr√≥ximos eventos, y todos est√°n invitados a ser parte de esta historia.

La transformaci√≥n digital comienza con personas que comparten conocimiento. El SAP Inside Track Ciudad del Este 2025 demostr√≥ que Paraguay est√° m√°s que preparado para escribir su propio cap√≠tulo en la historia de SAP en Am√©rica Latina.

entry.title: SAP Community Voice: SAP TechEd in Berlin special edition!
entry.content:
Last week happened one of the biggest highlights of the year for our SAP community! The SAP TechEd in Berlin was an incredible opportunity to bring together Developers, SAP Mentors and Champions, experts, and community members from all over the world for an inspiring few days filled with innovation, learning, and sharing. From the main keynote announcements to hands-on sessions and vibrant community meetups, SAP TechEd in Berlin 2025 was a true celebration of connections and technology.

Whether you joined us on-site or virtually, there were so many great announcements to take in from exciting updates in ABAP and AI, to the amazing energy of the SAP Community Clubhouse. Let‚Äôs take a closer look at some of the best moments and highlights!

Blog Posts about SAP TechEd in Berlin

SAP HANA Cloud goes agentic! 

SAP HANA Cloud is our cloud-native database as a service, delivering in-memory performance, multi-model data processing capabilities and elastic scale for intelligent applications. And to make these capabilities even more accessible and enable full power of the system, in early 2026, due to two new agents: the Discovery Agent and the Data Agent. The Discovery Agent is your companion to find and identify relevant tables, views, columns, and user-defined functions for any business case. The Data Agent converts natural-language intent into executable queries (e.g., SQL) to retrieve your data of interest. For this to be possible, SAP is expanding the SAP HANA Cloud knowledge graph engine with the ability to generate custom database-objects. Agents and the built-in knowledge graph help developers and business users find the right data through context and relationships. To understand more, SAP¬¥s Thomas Hammer and ‚ÄØShabana Samsudheen prepared two great blog posts with details about fully Agentic Multi-Model database.  

Read Thomas blog post here  

Read Shabana blog post here 

Paradigm Shift for Enterprise AI 

One of the biggest announcements at SAP TechEd in Berlin, was the launch of SAP table-native foundation model, pre-trained to understand your table-based business data out-of-the-box across a vast range of predictive tasks, without the need for task-specific training or fine-tuning. Until now, most organizations were using different AI specialist models for each prediction task, what makes the AI landscape slower. The launch of sap-rpt-1 (rpt stands for Relational Pretrained Transformer), it is designed to be a single universal AI engine table-native, for SAP¬¥s customers and partners. The best part is the in-context learning capability, which means that sap-rpt-1 doesn¬¥t require task-specific training, just need to receive labeled table row examples of your predictive task‚ÄØin-context, and the model delivers a highly accurate prediction. This engine was developed by our AI researchers (recently‚ÄØpublished‚ÄØto this year‚Äôs NeurIPS conference) and they made sure to bring more details on a blog post for our SAP Community. We highly recommend taking a good look and learning how to start using the preview version. 

Read Philipp Herzig blog post here 

Key Innovations for the ABAP Cloud development  

At SAP TechEd in Berlin, one of the main spotlights was the announcements that redefine the ABAP Cloud development experience. The big 4 key innovations are: ABAP entering the era of Agentic AI, ABAP LLMs available on GenAI Hub, ABAP AI capabilities will be supported in earlier releases, and ABAP is embracing an open IDE strategy with VS Code (Visual Studio Code). These advancements mark a milestone in the continuous work of unlocking intelligent automation, more productivity, and smarter enterprise solutions. SAP¬¥s Sonja Lienard, published a full blog post with all the main details. If you have always been an ABAP fan and have been looking for a more modern experience, this is a must read!

Read Sonja Lienard blog post here 

SAP Community Clubhouse highlights 

For our SAP community, SAP TechEd in Berlin meant more than learning and developing skills, it was also an amazing opportunity to experience real-life connections with people who have been connected online for so many years. Inside the SAP Community, all members get to experience the feeling of being supported and offering help, while gaining valuable insights just through sharing and exchanging blog posts, forums, groups, and much more. At the SAP Community Clubhouse, all this experience was reflected in the interactions, presentations, and small chats. Our team is incredibly happy and grateful to everyone who could join. We know that being present at events like this can take a lot of work, and we highly appreciate everyone‚Äôs effort in participating and bringing so much positive energy. 

SAP Mentor Bj√∂rn Schulz wrote an amazing recap (read the full blog post here) and shared some of his favorite parts of his first time at SAP TechEd. Check out some of his highlights: 

  • The Developer Keynote creatively showcased teamwork across technologies like HANA Cloud, AI, and Process Automation, embracing real-world ‚Äúdeveloper mistakes‚Äù that made it relatable. 
  • The Joule LLM for ABAP Developers promises smarter, context-aware coding support within the Business Technology Platform. 
  • Despite logistical hiccups, SAP TechEd 2025 offered valuable learning, networking, and a glimpse into the next era of ABAP and AI integration. The community spirit and new developer tools made it a rewarding experience. 

SAP Community news 

Updates for a better experience

Our SAP Community platform has gained some great new features over the past two weeks! We know how important it is for everyone to always have the best navigation experience possible, and these updates were designed to make connecting, sharing, and discovering content even easier. The main changes are:  

  • Filter My Content by Interaction Style: Allows to filter the My Content Page by distinct types of interaction (e.g., Answers and Replies), which makes it easier to find posts you have created. 
  • SAP Managed Tag Page: Now the width of the page has been extended to give a better overview of the list. 
  • TKB Documents: The last edited date has been added to TKB Documents, so now members can be more certain about when the information has been published and is still relatable.  

Got a minute? Tell us what you think!

We‚Äôd appreciate if you could take part in this short survey about SAP Community. By answering these 6 questions, you‚Äôre helping the community a lot! Access the survey link here

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Reinventando la Experiencia del Talento- SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
El pasado evento SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 nos regal√≥ una charla inspiradora de la mano de Carolina Salinas Glikin, COO de Qactions System, quien con m√°s de 20 a√±os de experiencia en el ecosistema SAP, nos llev√≥ en un viaje desde los "grises d√≠as del SAP duro" hasta la revoluci√≥n actual de la gesti√≥n del talento.

De Empleados a Personas: El Cambio de Paradigma
Carolina comenz√≥ compartiendo su propia transformaci√≥n: de profesional de recursos humanos a especialista en sistemas, impulsada por la necesidad de optimizar procesos. Pero lo m√°s revelador fue c√≥mo SAP SuccessFactors representa un cambio fundamental en la filosof√≠a empresarial

"Ya no somos empleados, somos personas, colaboradores, talento. Y el coraz√≥n de las empresas somos todos nosotros."

Este cambio no es solo sem√°ntico. SAP desarroll√≥ SuccessFactors con profesionales de RR.HH., no solo con ingenieros, creando una plataforma que entiende las necesidades reales del √°rea.

SITCDE2025

El Ecosistema Modular: Crecer a tu Ritmo
Una de las revelaciones m√°s importantes: no necesitas implementar todo de una vez. SAP SuccessFactors es modular, permitiendo a las empresas:

Core HR - La Base S√≥lida
Employee Central: El coraz√≥n del sistema donde vive toda la informaci√≥n del colaborador
Employee Central Payroll: Liquidaci√≥n de sueldos inteligente que calcula retroactivos autom√°ticamente (¬°adi√≥s a las pesadillas de c√°lculos manuales!)
Time Tracking: Gesti√≥n de tiempos que incluso permite fichadas desde el celular con geolocalizaci√≥n

Gesti√≥n del Talento - El Crecimiento

Onboarding/Recruiting: Desde atraer talento hasta que el colaborador se sienta parte desde el d√≠a uno
Performance & Goals: Evaluaciones de desempe√±o con IA generativa que ayuda a redactar objetivos
Learning y Compensation: Capacitaci√≥n continua y compensaciones justas basadas en resultados

La Autogesti√≥n: Empoderando a las Personas
Carolina destac√≥ un punto crucial: la autogesti√≥n no es una carga para el colaborador, es un empoderamiento. Cuando un colaborador puede:

Solicitar vacaciones desde su celular
Ver cu√°ndo debe regresar autom√°ticamente
Cargar cambios de domicilio
Acceder a su informaci√≥n desde cualquier lugar

Se siente m√°s parte de la empresa, liberando a RR.HH. para enfocarse en lo estrat√©gico: detectar talento, dise√±ar planes de carrera, gestionar la cultura organizacional.

SITCDE2025
Innovaci√≥n que Sorprende: JOULE
La cereza del pastel fue JOULE, el asistente de IA que permite interactuar con todo el sistema en lenguaje natural. Imagina preguntarle: "¬øC√≥mo cargo mis vacaciones?" y que √©l no solo te explique, sino que te las cargue despu√©s de verificar disponibilidad y posibles conflictos con tu equipo.

Anal√≠tica que Transforma Datos en Decisiones
Con SAP Analytics Cloud integrado, los dashboards ya no son aburridos reportes en Excel. Ahora puedes visualizar en tiempo real:

-Distribuci√≥n de g√©nero por pa√≠s, ciudad o sucursal
-Efectividad de capacitaciones
-Resultados de evaluaciones de desempe√±o
-Y todo esto sin costo adicional

SITCDE2025

El Mensaje Final
"No se trata solo de gestionar personas, sino de construir experiencias que impulsen el √©xito organizacional a largo plazo."

SAP SuccessFactors no es solo un sistema de RR.HH., es una plataforma de experiencias que pone a las personas en el centro, permitiendo que las empresas crezcan de manera sostenible con su gente, no a pesar de ella.

¬øLo mejor? Todo es escalable, modular, y se integra nativamente con otros sistemas SAP y no-SAP. Una soluci√≥n pensada para el mundo actual, donde el talento es el verdadero diferenciador competitivo.
¬øTu empresa est√° lista para reinventar la experiencia de su talento?

Gracias a Qactions System por compartir esta visi√≥n y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay por hacer posible estos espacios de aprendizaje. #SITCDE2025

entry.title: Integrating Platform Events using Salesforce PubSub Adapter in SAP Cloud Integration
entry.content:
In this post, we will explore how to use the Salesforce PubSub adapter in SAP Cloud Integration (SAP CI) to subscribe to Platform Events in Salesforce. This approach enables real-time, event-driven communication between Salesforce and external systems without the need for frequent polling or API calls.

What is the Salesforce PubSub Adapter (Sender)?

The Salesforce Pub/Sub Sender Adapter uses the Pub/Sub API, built on the gRPC protocol. It allows SAP CI to listen to Salesforce event streams in real time. Instead of polling for changes or using REST API calls, this adapter maintains a persistent connection to Salesforce‚Äôs event bus, capturing events as they occur.

What are Platform Events?

Platform Events in Salesforce provide an event-driven mechanism to exchange data inside and outside Salesforce in real time. Instead of continuously querying Salesforce for changes, external systems like SAP CI can subscribe to Platform Events and react immediately when specific business conditions occur. This results in faster, cleaner, and more scalable integrations.

The true power of Platform Events lies in their ability to capture only the relevant business signals. Unlike Change Data Capture, which publishes every record change, Platform Events allow you to include only required fields, apply qualification rules, and fire events only when specific business conditions are met. This ensures cleaner, lighter, and more meaningful integrations ‚Äî especially in event-driven scenarios where SAP CI needs to react only to critical events rather than process noise.

Creating a Platform Event in Salesforce

Let‚Äôs create a sample Platform Event for the Account object. This event will send qualified Account data.

  1. Navigate to Setup ‚Üí Quick Find ‚Üí Platform Events ‚Üí New Platform Event.
  2. Fill in the details:
      ‚Ä¢ Singular Label: AccountPlatformEvent
      ‚Ä¢ Plural Label: Accounts
      ‚Ä¢ API Name: AccountPlatformEvent__e
      ‚Ä¢ Description: Event to send qualified Accounts to External system.
      ‚Ä¢ Leave default retention (72 hours).
  3. Create required custom fields (example):
      ‚Ä¢ AccountId__c ‚Äì Text(18)
      ‚Ä¢ Name__c ‚Äì Text(255)
      ‚Ä¢ Industry__c ‚Äì Text(50)
      ‚Ä¢ Rating__c ‚Äì Text(50)

These fields define the schema of your event messages.

Publishing Platform Events Using Apex

Next, we will publish the Platform Event whenever an Account record is created or updated. Below is a sample Apex trigger that publishes an event message, it can be created from Developer console of the Salesforce.

trigger AccountPlatformEventPublisher on Account (after insert, after update) {
    List<AccountPlatformEvent__e> events = new List<AccountPlatformEvent__e>();
    for (Account acc : Trigger.new) {
        events.add(new AccountPlatformEvent__e(
            AccountId__c        = acc.Id,
            AccountSource__c    = acc.AccountSource,
            AnnualRevenue__c    = acc.AnnualRevenue,
            BillingCity__c      = acc.BillingCity,
            BillingCountry__c   = acc.BillingCountry,
            BillingStreet__c    = acc.BillingStreet,
            CreatedDate__c      = acc.CreatedDate,
            CurrencyIsoCode__c  = acc.CurrencyIsoCode,
            Industry__c         = acc.Industry,
            IsDeleted__c        = String.valueOf(acc.IsDeleted),
            LastModifiedDate__c = acc.LastModifiedDate,
            Name__c             = acc.Name,
            Rating__c           = acc.Rating,
            SAPCustomerNumber__c= acc.SAPCustomerNumber__c
        ));
    }
    if (!events.isEmpty()) {
        Database.SaveResult[] results = EventBus.publish(events);
        System.debug('Published ' + results.size() + ' Account events.');
    }
}

Subscribing to Platform Events Using the PubSub Adapter

Once the Platform Event is created, configure the Salesforce Pub/Sub Sender adapter in SAP CI to subscribe to the event channel. Below are key features and configuration parameters:

  • Subscribe to Salesforce channels to receive events.
  • Supports publishing of events to channels with defined schemas.
  • Retrieve schemas using the 'Get Schema' operation.
  • Support for OAuth 2.0 Username-Password and OAuth 2.0 JWT Bearer authentication.
  • Replay options to control event retrieval (Earliest, Latest, Custom).
  • Error handling and re-subscription mechanisms.

 Below is the detailed description of each parameter used in this iflow covering Salesforce PubSub adapter.

We are using sender Salesforce PubSub adapter to consume the platform events, configurations are as below.

SAP CI Iflow:

Sender : Pick a sender from the pallet and select the Salesforce Pub Sub Adapter from the adapter list

Configuration of Salesforce Pub Sub Sender Adapter:

Parameter Description:

Host

Specify the host to which the proxy requests are sent for the gRPC API (towards the gRPC host). The proxy requests to the gRPC host will go through the proxy. Example: api.pubsub.salesforce.com

Port

Specify the port to which the proxy requests are sent for the gRPC API (towards the gRPC port). The proxy requests to the gRPC port will go through the proxy. Example: 7443

Tenant ID

Specify the Salesforce Organization ID, this can be found in Company Information within the "Setup" page on Salesforce

Authentication

Select the authentication type to be used for the connection to Salesforce:

  • OAuth 2.0 Username-Password
  • OAuth 2.0 JWT Bearer
‚ÑπÔ∏èThe following fields are available when OAuth 2.0 JWT Bearer is selected.

Token URL

Specify the login endpoint to your Salesforce instance url. Example: https://login.salesforce.com for Salesforce production environment, https://test.salesforce.com for Salesforce Sandbox environment and https://{MyDomain}.my.salesforce.com in case MyDomain is enabled on the org.

Credential Name

Specify the User Credentials storing the username-password details.

Security Token Alias

Specify the Security Token Alias that refers to the secure parameter.

This can be omitted if your SAP CI IP address has been whitelisted in Salesforce

OAuth Credential Name

Specify the User Credentials that stores the Consumer key-Client secret pair.

‚ÑπÔ∏èThe following fields are available when OAuth 2.0 JWT Bearer is selected.

Audience

Specify the login endpoint to your Salesforce instance URL. Example: https://login.salesforce.com for Salesforce production environment, https://test.salesforce.com for Salesforce Sandbox environment, and https://site.force.com/customers if implementing for an Experience Cloud site

Subject Alias

Specify the Secure Parmeter that stores the username of the Salesforce user.

Issuer Alias

Specify the Secure Parameter which indicates the OAuth client_id of the connected app in Salesforce for which the certificate was registered.

Keystore Alias

Specify the alias name of the added JKS file in Keystore as a Key Pair. It consists of a key and certificate to sign the JWT

Expiration (in ms)

Specifies the validity of the assertion in milliseconds

 Processing Tab:

 

Channel NameSpecify the Salesforce channel name to perform the subscription. (here we will use the /event/ and then the API name of the Platform event created in previous steps in Salesfoce.)
Replay ID Approach

Select the replay option in the first FetchRequest:

  • Events from a specific position (Custom) 
  • Events from earliest position (Earliest) ‚Ä¢
  • Events from latest position (Latest) The default value is Events from latest position (Latest) which allows subscription only to new event messages and does not retrieve earlier event messages stored in the event bus

Replay ID

Specify the Replay ID value. The Replay ID is populated by Salesforce and refers to the position of the event in the event stream. Example: 8381402

Request Batch Size

Specify the number of events to be requested in the Salesforce fetchRequest. The default value is 100

Replay Preset for Invalid Replay ID

Select the replay option in case ‚Äúsfdc.platform.eventbus.grpc.subscription.fetch.replayid.corrupted‚Äù error occurs:

  • Events from latest position (Latest)
  • Events from earliest position (Earliest) The default value is Events from earliest position (Earliest) indicating the earlier event messages stored in the event bus.

Duplicate Check Expiration (in ms)

Specify the expiry time in milliseconds while handling the Duplicate check. The default value is 300000

Process Errors as an Event

Enable this property to write error events in the exchange. If disabled, issues connecting to event streams will only be written to the logs

Deployment of the IFlow:

Now lets deploy the IFlow and see how this works, For demostration, I will create the Account record and then update it.

Demo:

New account created in Salesforce:

As soon the record is saved in the Salesforce, the event/message is generated which is received by SAP CI

{
  "payload": {
    "AccountId__c": "001J100000X6REOIA3",
    "AnnualRevenue__c": 10000,
    "CurrencyIsoCode__c": "USD",
    "Name__c": "Test Account For Demo",
    "BillingCountry__c": "India",
    "Industry__c": "Finance",
    "AccountSource__c": null,
    "CreatedDate__c": 1760449971000,
    "CreatedById": "0055g00000AqVaAAAV",
    "SAPCustomerNumber__c": "101",
    "CreatedDate": 1760449971276,
    "BillingStreet__c": "ABC Road",
    "LastModifiedDate__c": 1760449971000,
    "Rating__c": "Warm",
    "IsDeleted__c": "false",
    "BillingCity__c": "Pune"
  },
  "schemaId": "3lrXZmbw8vDsOdsDj74Qpw",
  "id": "644d0292-d8b7-4fd4-9c5d-5f64eefb7bca"
}

Now lets update the Account and see the event, I will update the name and the City

New event received in SAP CI

In order to see the replay Id of the event we need to check the headers after the Salesforce PubSub adapter step:

Replay Id when Account was created:

Replay Id of the update event:

Observations

  • Only the fields defined in the Platform Event schema are included in the payload. 
  • Each update triggers the transmission of the complete message again.

Conclusion

Using Salesforce Platform Events with the SAP CI PubSub adapter enables truly event-driven integrations between Salesforce and external systems. By defining only the necessary fields and publishing them through an Apex trigger, you ensure that downstream systems receive lean, relevant data instead of full records. The Pub/Sub adapter maintains a persistent gRPC connection for real-time delivery, minimizing API usage and latency. This approach provides a scalable, reliable, and modern integration pattern for enterprise-grade Salesforce-to-SAP scenarios.

Thanks,

Manish Deshpande

entry.title: Sydney Stammtisch Recap Nov '25 (Mastering SAP vs. Tech Ed On Tour)
entry.content:
Usually our #Sydney #Stammtisch events are planned a few weeks in advance (I plan ahead to a fault) but this one ended up being somewhat impromptu.  We had what I thought was our last event of 2025 a couple of weeks ago.  As Mastering SAP often organise great social events as part of their conference (this year a Tech Ed On Tour Event no less) I thought that we shouldn't 'compete' with whatever they had planned.  Well, it turned out that there wasn't an official social event in the calendar so when@AnnePetteroe reached out to us we were already open to the idea of holding a (possibly unprecedented) fifth Stammtisch of 2025.

It was a bit of a scramble but @jeff_t managed to line up a great venue - Sydney Pumphouse - which was very close to the conference venue and close to where most visitors were staying.  We had a great crowd of men & women, both on the younger side and on the slightly less young side.  We had native born Australians alongside people from pretty much every continent (ish).  We had people with blue beards, and people without blue beards (I would say that the latter were in the majority).

Debra from Mastering used the 5mins that she had free on the eve of the conference to come and meet everyone, which was awesome.

As we get more and more people attending Stammtisch my photos seem to do less and less justice to the event.  It was quite dark inside and so I mainly grabbed a few snaps on the terrace.  I thought there were at least 50 attendees but I saw @thomas_jung say on YouTube that there were '70-80' people there, and I wouldn't like to argue with Thomas!

Please feel free to add your own photos in the comments.

A real highlight was the three students who showed having seen @josh_bentley on You Tube shorts mentioning Stammtisch.  Tamer put in a call to someone at Mastering SAP to get them access to the conference somehow, which was just awesome of him. 

It was a great start to what turned out to be a great conference and I do wonder whether we should repeat the same format next year.  Tuesday night is a tough night to get locals out, and we missed many fly-ins because they were due to arrive too late or because their flights got delayed by strong winds.  We might have got more locals if we had given more notice. We could go for the end of Day 1 of the conference, but then there may be other events then (like the awesome RevTrac drinks).

What do you think?

Certainly no-one should be booking flights to Sydney for Mastering SAP Collaborate 2026 without checking with us first üòâ

Thanks so much to everyone who came!

entry.title: SAP AIDevCon 2025: A Day That Redefined AI Innovation
entry.content:
What an absolute triumph yesterday was! The SAP AIDevCon 2025 event on November 8th wasn't just another conference; it was a powerful convergence of ideas, talent, and technology that truly demonstrated the revolutionary potential of Business AI.

The air in the venue was charged with incredible energy and vibrancy. We saw over 50+ passionate participants from more than 26+ diverse corporates and 3 key Indian universities come together. The goal was simple but profound: to not just talk about AI, but to build it.

Igniting Innovation: The Hands-on Experience

The day kicked off with invaluable networking‚Äîthe kind that sparks future projects‚Äîfollowed by an inspiring keynote address from our VP, Head of APAC. This set the stage for the true excitement: the hands-on experience.

Our participants didn't just attend sessions; they became builders. They immersed themselves in cutting-edge SAP BTP AI services, specifically using:

  • SAP Build for powerful low-code process automation.

  • Document AI to intelligently process unstructured business documents.

  • Translation Hub to instantly break down language barriers in applications.

The highlight was the intensive hackathon. Our audience, a perfect blend of industry experts and bright university students, worked in fierce yet collaborative teams. The atmosphere was one of positive vibes and shared goals, where they had to train, exhibit, and deliver industry-ready prototypes.

SAP Build Sessions

Hands-On Sessions

Breakthrough Prototypes: Solving Real Problems

The solutions developed were not academic exercises‚Äîthey were direct answers to critical business challenges. The teams built phenomenal prototypes that showcased the speed and scale possible with SAP BTP AI, focusing on real-world impact:

  1. Dispute Management: Creating smart solutions to automate and accelerate complex financial and operational dispute resolution.

  2. Piracy Protection: Leveraging AI to build robust, automated systems for safeguarding digital assets and intellectual property.

  3. Wellbeing: Developing AI-driven applications to enhance employee and user well-being through proactive insights and personalised support.

This entire day was a masterclass in learning, teamwork, and execution, all driven by the powerful capabilities of SAP Business Technology Platform.

Super Energetic - SAP Community

Gratitude for Our Ecosystem of Heroes

A monumental event like this is only possible because of a dedicated community. A huge and sincere thank you goes out to:

  • Our incredible mentors and volunteers whose guidance transformed ideas into working code.

  • All the brilliant participants for bringing their enthusiasm and skill.

  • The SAP Leadership for championing the vision of an AI-first future.

  • The unsung heroes in IT, Security, and Admin, and each and every hero behind the scenes, whose seamless work made the entire event feel effortless.

Networking

Hackathon - Planning

SAP Document AI Sessions

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation by College Students

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon Winner

That's me!

What's Next? A Teaser!

The energy and innovation we witnessed at SAP AIDevCon 2025 proved one thing: the appetite for building intelligent, transformative solutions is immense.

This event was a resounding success, and we're already hard at work planning something even bigger and better. Stay tuned, because we are preparing to launch the next, even more exciting, version of AIDevCon very soon!

Keep learning, keep building, and we look forward to welcoming you back to the innovation floor.

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: SAP Public Cloud, agilidade e ganhos com ERP em Nuvem
entry.content:
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025 nos regal√≥ una charla esclarecedora de @Jean_Chess_IT Jean Tiago Baena, Director de Chess SAP Services y consultor SAP MM con m√°s de 18 a√±os de experiencia en implementaciones SAP ECC y S/4 HANA con actuaci√≥n en proyectos globales. Jean, quien comenz√≥ como frentista en un puesto de gasolina y hoy dirige su propia consultor√≠a SAP en Londrina, nos gui√≥ a trav√©s de un fascinante viaje sobre c√≥mo SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud est√° transformando la manera en que las empresas gestionan sus procesos de negocio.


Los Dolores Encontrados en las Empresas
Jean identific√≥ claramente las principales dolores que las empresas enfrentan hoy cuando piensan en tecnolog√≠a ERP:

  • Falta de agilidad para adaptaci√≥n - Muchos empresarios piensan que es muy demorado y costoso
  • Procesos ineficientes y desconectados
  • Falta de transparencia en automatizaciones
  • Preocupaci√≥n con seguridad digital
  • Demora en obtener un sistema actualizado - Un tiempo muy largo para tener tecnolog√≠a de √∫ltima generaci√≥n

Como destac√≥ Jean: "Los empresarios siempre piensan que quieren la mejor tecnolog√≠a de √∫ltima generaci√≥n, m√°s cuando piensan en invertir, piensan que es una dolor de cabeza, es demorado y las mejores pr√°cticas son dif√≠ciles de ejecutar."

GROW with SAP: Las Soluciones
Jean present√≥ c√≥mo GROW with SAP resuelve estas dolores:

  • Implantaci√≥n r√°pida de nuevos negocios y expansi√≥n - Implementaci√≥n muy r√°pida de rollouts para nuevas filiales
  • Procesos alineados con las mejores pr√°cticas globales de la industria - Un sistema "ready to run", pronto para usar
  • Entendimiento de lo que es m√°s cr√≠tico y lo que realmente impacta para automatizaci√≥n
  • Confianza en actualizaciones de seguridad continua en empresa certificada
  • Adopci√≥n de un sistema "pronto para rodar" que crece con el negocio

Dos Caminos: RISE y GROW with SAP
Jean explic√≥ las dos abordajes que SAP ofrece:
RISE with SAP: Para procesos muy complejos, compa√±√≠as muy grandes como compa√±√≠as de petr√≥leo, compa√±√≠as globales con negocios muy complejos.
GROW with SAP: Donde est√°n las primeras inversiones de SAP en el mundo. Es un sistema que puede ser implementado muy r√°pido en las compa√±√≠as. La migraci√≥n para compa√±√≠as que usan Business One es muy m√°s f√°cil porque hay una integraci√≥n muy r√°pida.


Tiempos de Implementaci√≥n: La Gran Diferencia
Jean mostr√≥ datos concretos sobre los tiempos de implementaci√≥n:

  • SAP S/4 HANA Cloud: Media de 4.5 meses (1 a 9 meses)
  • Conversi√≥n t√≠pica de sistema: 8 a 12 meses
  • Implementaci√≥n S/4 HANA on-premise (full suite): 11 a 15 meses
  • Implementaciones complejas (full suite): 10 a 48+ meses

Actualizaciones Continuas: Innovaci√≥n sin Proyectos
Uno de los puntos m√°s destacados por Jean fue el modelo de actualizaciones:

Actualizaciones dos veces por a√±o: En febrero y en agosto hay upgrade autom√°tico.
Como Jean explic√≥: "Quien hoy trabaja con SAP sabe que un upgrade es algo complejo, demorado, que muda toda la compa√±√≠a. Hay que pensar en desarrollos Z, programas Z que ser√°n afectados, muchos tests, costo, tiempo..."
En Cloud ERP: "Las actualizaciones son dos veces por a√±o, y el cliente no precisa planear nada. Los updates son autom√°ticos por SAP. Globalmente su ERP, su sistema est√° actualizado en todos los pa√≠ses de una sola vez."
Las versiones siguen el modelo: 2508, 2602, 2608, 2702... sin necesidad de proyectos de upgrade.

Cloud ERP Inteligente: Las Caracter√≠sticas

  • Pronto para usar
  • Actualizado con las mejores pr√°cticas
  • Continua innovaci√≥n hecha por SAP
  • Simplificaci√≥n de tareas diarias
  • Crecimiento de negocios soportado por SAP
  • Seguridad con actualizaci√≥n constante

La Experiencia del Usuario
Jean mostr√≥ la evoluci√≥n dram√°tica de la interfaz SAP, desde las pantallas en blanco y negro del R/2 (a√±os 80), pasando por versiones m√°s amigables de los 90, el SAP GUI tradicional, hasta llegar a la moderna interfaz Fiori donde:

  • Apps organizadas como favoritos - Como en una web o celular
  • Pantallas totalmente customizadas por perfil de acceso
  • Noticias y conexi√≥n con informaciones de la compa√±√≠a
  • Videos integrados en el sistema
  • Total compatibilidad con movilidad - Tel√©fonos, dispositivos m√≥viles
  • Indicadores de Business Intelligence en la palma de la mano

Mejores Pr√°cticas Nativas: SAP Signavio Process Navigator
Durante la presentacion se demostr√≥ c√≥mo las mejores pr√°cticas vienen preconfiguradas en el sistema, listas para activar directamente.
Fit-to-Standard: El Nuevo Paradigma
Jean fue enf√°tico sobre el cambio de mentalidad necesario:
"Las compa√±√≠as van a pensar m√°s en usar SAP Standard, no m√°s tantos desarrollos, no m√°s tantas customizaciones, porque el est√°ndar es pensado, es desarrollado por muchos a√±os para contener las mejores pr√°cticas."
"Los clientes solamente adoptan y usan, no piensan 'voy a mudar ese SAP porque mi negocio es diferente'. Ya viene con las mejores pr√°cticas y los clientes se adaptan a esta fe de no querer transformar SAP con customizaciones que van a demorar, gastar."
La ventaja: "Si tiene un modelo est√°ndar, puede trabajar en Paraguay, Argentina, Estados Unidos, Brasil, Europa con el mismo, sin mudanzas. Y ah√≠ esto es m√°s √°gil y con costo menor."

Metodolog√≠a SAP Activate
fases del proyecto:

  • Discover - Definici√≥n inicial del scope
  • Prepare - Preparaci√≥n para Fit-to-Standard con Business Driven Configuration
  • Explore - Workshop Fit-to-Standard mostrando procesos y scripts
  • Realize - Implementaci√≥n

"Cuando se asigna un contrato, hoy o ma√±ana ya puede usar el sistema. En modelos anteriores, se esperaba 30, 60 d√≠as para tener una base de datos de SAP. Ahora, el contrato est√° firmado y los d√≠as siguientes ya puede hacer un logon en el sistema."

Implementaci√≥n en Paraguay y Argentina: Jean destac√≥ que en pa√≠ses como Paraguay y Argentina, donde no hay localizaciones tan complejas como Brasil, "es mucho m√°s r√°pido". En Brasil, los impuestos son "los m√°s complejos del mundo", pero en pa√≠ses con pocas diferenciaciones de cargos e impuestos, la implementaci√≥n es "muy m√°s √°gil y con menor costo".
El proyecto t√≠pico de Public Cloud es de 4 a 6 meses.
Configuraci√≥n sin SPRO: Central Business Configuration
Jean explic√≥ el cambio fundamental en la configuraci√≥n:
"No m√°s tenemos las configuraciones que conocemos como SPRO. Ahora hacemos configuraciones con CBC, Central Business Configuration."

Extensibilidad con SAP BTP
Opciones de extensibilidad:
Low Code / No Code:

  • Bajo c√≥digo de programaci√≥n
  • Trabajamos en la pantalla moviendo campos con el mouse
  • Custom Fields, Custom Business Objects, Custom CDS Views
  • Custom Analytical Queries
  • Output Management customizado

Pro Code:

  • Posibilidad de crear apps usando APIs e integraciones
  • APIs como "manera moderna de conectar sistemas, hacer customizaciones, volcarlas para web"
  • "Flexibilidad controlada para atender necesidades espec√≠ficas"

Joule: Inteligencia Artificial Integrada
Jean finaliz√≥ mostrando Joule, la inteligencia artificial nativa de SAP que ya viene integrada en Cloud ERP:
"La agilidad, la informaci√≥n va a estar en la mano de ustedes, de usuarios, de gerentes, de directores. En una reuni√≥n de negocios, en un viaje que precisa acceder a los datos, ya est√° todo en la palma de la mano."

C√≥mo funciona Joule:

  • Chat dentro del sistema
  • Consultas en lenguaje natural: "Quiero un gr√°fico de las ventas, cu√°nto estoy facturando"
  • Responde "como personas reales con la inteligencia artificial"
  • "No voy a m√°s buscar un reporte, voy a preguntar: 'Por favor, quiero saber c√≥mo est√° finanzas en abierto, documentos a pagar, cu√°nto se pag√≥ hoy' y viene autom√°ticamente"

El Mensaje Final
Jean cerr√≥ su presentaci√≥n destacando que la informaci√≥n est√° ahora al alcance de todos, f√°cil y r√°pido, permitiendo tomar decisiones de negocio desde cualquier lugar.
La transformaci√≥n es clara: De un ERP complejo y demorado a una plataforma √°gil, con mejores pr√°cticas globales, actualizaciones autom√°ticas, y una experiencia de usuario moderna que pone la informaci√≥n en la palma de la mano.

Agradecimientos especiales a Chess SAP Services por compartir esta valiosa experiencia y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025 por crear este espacio de aprendizaje.


SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Ciberseguridad en la era cu√°ntica
entry.content:
El pasado evento SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 nos sorprendi√≥ con una charla reveladora de la mano de Carlos Ben√≠tez, CTO de Platinum Ciberseguridad, quien con su vasta experiencia nos llev√≥ por un recorrido fascinante: desde los desaf√≠os actuales de la Inteligencia Artificial hasta las amenazas inminentes de la computaci√≥n cu√°ntica



El Nuevo Escenario Digital
Carlos comenz√≥ estableciendo el contexto: las empresas dependen cada vez m√°s de sistemas cr√≠ticos como SAP, y la superficie de ataque crece exponencialmente con la digitalizaci√≥n. La ciberseguridad ya no es solo un tema t√©cnico, sino un factor estrat√©gico para la supervivencia empresarial.

IA: ¬øSuperh√©roe o Villano?
La Inteligencia Artificial se presenta con dos caras. Por un lado, herramientas como PentestGPT automatizan la detecci√≥n de vulnerabilidades sin necesidad de conocimientos profundos. Los deepfakes permiten suplantar identidades y burlar controles biom√©tricos. Y el mal uso de IA conversacional expone informaci√≥n sensible de las empresas debido a problemas de separaci√≥n entre usuarios.
Pero la IA tambi√©n se viste de superh√©roe: ayuda en la detecci√≥n y prevenci√≥n de amenazas, protege endpoints mediante XDR, y acelera la respuesta a incidentes a trav√©s de sistemas SOAR. El desaf√≠o est√° en usar estas herramientas de manera responsable.


Computaci√≥n Cu√°ntica: El Verdadero Disruptor
Aqu√≠ lleg√≥ el momento m√°s impactante de la presentaci√≥n. Carlos explic√≥ c√≥mo las computadoras cu√°nticas, que ya existen (de fabricantes como IBM, D-Wave e IonQ), cambiar√°n radicalmente el panorama de la ciberseguridad.
Estas m√°quinas pueden resolver en segundos problemas que tomar√≠an a√±os a computadoras tradicionales. El ejemplo del algoritmo de Shor fue contundente: la criptograf√≠a RSA que protege nuestras comunicaciones HTTPS, firmas digitales y transacciones blockchain ser√° vulnerable.

Dos Amenazas Reales
Carlos destac√≥ dos ataques concretos:
HTDL (Harvest Today, Decrypt Later): Atacantes est√°n capturando tr√°fico cifrado HOY, almacen√°ndolo y vendi√©ndolo en la dark web, esperando el momento en que puedan descifrarlo con computadoras cu√°nticas.
Falsificaci√≥n de Firmas Digitales: Con acceso a la clave p√∫blica, se podr√° generar la clave privada, permitiendo falsificar documentos y contratos de manera indistinguible del original.


La Soluci√≥n: Criptograf√≠a Post-Cu√°ntica
La buena noticia es que NIST ya estandariz√≥ tres algoritmos post-cu√°nticos (FIPS 203, 204 y 205) resistentes a ataques cu√°nticos. El momento de migrar es AHORA, para minimizar el "per√≠odo de riesgo" de datos cr√≠ticos que deben permanecer seguros por a√±os.
Carlos present√≥ el Teorema de Mosca, explicando visualmente por qu√© cada d√≠a que pospongamos la migraci√≥n aumenta la ventana de vulnerabilidad de nuestros datos hist√≥ricos.

SAP en la Mira
Como concentrador de procesos vitales de negocio, SAP es un objetivo especialmente atractivo. Carlos revel√≥ que SAP participa activamente en QUTAC (Quantum Technology and Application Consortium) y ya investiga criptograf√≠a quantum-safe, aunque a√∫n no hay anuncios p√∫blicos sobre la migraci√≥n completa.

Estrategia Quantum-Safe
Platinum Ciberseguridad, en alianza con IBM, ofrece un servicio estructurado en cinco fases:

  • Inventario de todos los sistemas que usan criptograf√≠a
  • Clasificaci√≥n de datos seg√∫n tiempo de vida requerido
  • Identificaci√≥n de dependencias de vendors
  • Planificaci√≥n de la migraci√≥n y mitigaciones
  • Remediaci√≥n y mantenimiento continuo

 

Conclusi√≥n
La presentaci√≥n de Carlos fue clara: prepararse hoy es la clave para un futuro seguro. La amenaza cu√°ntica no es ciencia ficci√≥n, est√° m√°s cerca de lo que pensamos. IonQ proyecta tener 8,000 qubits l√≥gicos para 2028, suficientes para romper RSA-2048.
Como comunidad SAP, debemos tomar conciencia de que la seguridad de nuestros sistemas va m√°s all√° de roles y perfiles. Es momento de evaluar riesgos presentes y futuros, fortalecer defensas t√©cnicas, y considerar socios expertos en esta transici√≥n hacia la era cu√°ntica.

Agradecemos a Platinum Ciberseguridad por compartir esta visi√≥n estrat√©gica y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay por facilitar estos espacios de conocimiento. #SITCDE2025
